choices.D: A minimum of five Cisco APIC appliances must be used in the data center network.
choices.A: Pre-existing vPC topology must be removed before the migration is started
choices.B: A permit-all contract must be used for traffic that flows inside the data center.
choices.C: Pre-existing FCoE must be removed from the Nexus devices.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Pre-existing FCoE must be removed from the Nexus devices.

choose C by elimination, other options wrong

questions.question_text: Which requirement applies to migration from Cisco NX-OS mode to Cisco ACI mode with Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switches?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Active-Active PBR Accros Pods is an improvement and not the opposite.

A C
A C

A: The connection state is always owned by a specific cluster node (the node that received the first leg for that specific connection). An intra-cluster redirection via the Inter-Cluster Link (ICL) is leveraged to redirect to that node traffic that may be received by other nodes of the cluster not owning the connection state for that specific flow.

C: The service node cluster needs to be deployed in routed mode. Deploying an active/active cluster in Layer 2 mode stretched across pods is not supported.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/white-paper-c11-739571.html

choices.B: This mode causes the traffic to flow asymmetrically
choices.C: Deployment occurs in go-to mode only.
choices.A: Traffic is dynamically redirected to the firewall that owns the connection.

questions.question_text: What are two PBR characteristics of the Cisco ACI Active-Active Across Pods deployment mode in Cisco ACI Multi-Pod design? (Choose two.)

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is configuring a vSwitch policy in the existing Cisco ACI fabric. The requirement is for the Cisco ACI leaf to learn individual MAC addresses from the same physical port. Which vSwitch policy configuration mode must be enabled to meet this requirement?

choices.D: all endpoints associated with VLAN 101 in BD10123
choices.C: all endpoints associated with VLAN 101, 102, and 103 in BD10123
choices.B: all endpoints associated with VLAN 101 in BD10123 on the leaf node
choices.A: all endpoints associated with VLAN 102 or 103 in BD10123 on the spine node

questions.question_text:
A Cisco ACI fabric is connected to a switched network that runs Spanning Tree Protocol on VLAN 101. VLANs 101, 102, and 103 are mapped to bridge domain BD10123.
The leaf node that is attached to this switched network receives a spanning-tree topology change notification. Which endpoints does ACI flush?

discussion.content: If it's PVST or Rapid-PVST+, the endpoint entries in the EPG(encap-vlan) will be flushed. But if it's MST TCN than all the VLANs inside that MST instance that part of the BD will be flushed.

Selected Answer: C
C. all endpoints associated with VLAN 101, 102, and 103 in BD10123

they are part of the same BD, no additional information about EPGs, so i think all will be flushed after receiving TCN

choices.A: BUM traffic between sites leverages ISN multicast replication.
choices.D: Contracts are local to the provided site.
choices.C: Spine head-end replication is used to forward BUM traffic between sites.
choices.B: The solution reduces control plane overhead.

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of a stretched bridge domain solution between Cisco ACI sites with Layer 2 flood enabled?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Spine head-end replication is used to forward BUM traffic between sites.
/all other options seem wrong, HER head end replication is for BUM traffic forwarding between sites
